alert.note: Alert for Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 11 at 7:43PM CDT until May 11 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hennepin County in east central Minnesota... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 742 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Bonifacius, or 20 miles south of Buffalo, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Delano around 750 PM CDT. Mound, Minnetrista and Excelsior around 755 PM CDT. Orono, Rockford, Wayzata, Independence and Maple Plain around 800 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Medina, Corcoran, Plymouth, Maple Grove, Brooklyn Center, Rogers, Brooklyn Park, Champlin, Coon Rapids and Fridley. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Minnesota.
